summary: Engineered data reconciliation logic to resolve critical protocol divergences between Order Management (COS) and Fulfilment (FPS) systems, ensuring 100% data integrity.
Architected high-performance integration endpoints for MoveService, enabling granular resource tracking at the order-line level.
Optimized database query performance via strategic indexing, eliminating latency bottlenecks during high-volume order drops.
Designed a configuration-driven CronJob framework using the Kubernetes Java SDK, automating complex store workflows (EPBZ) and removing manual operational overhead.
Implemented reliable asynchronous event triggers for DayReset processes, ensuring consistent state transitions across the platform.
Built dynamic management endpoints, empowering support teams to control job schedules without code deployments.
Picking App: Modernized the in-store Picking Application to support pre-picking workflows, decoupling device logic from backend complexity.
Picking App: Engineered fault-tolerant integration paths to ensure new pre-pick features did not destabilize critical standard picking operations.
Document Printing Service: Redesigned health-check mechanisms to eliminate cascading cluster failures, significantly improving service resilience.
Loading Service: Led the security hardening initiative by migrating hardcoded credentials to Kubernetes Secrets across the loading domain.
Loading Service: Optimized retry policies and removed legacy backoff technical debt, increasing message processing throughput.
Transformed the Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) Processor into a mission-critical Disaster Recovery component.
Architected a targeted replay mechanism allowing precise recovery of events by type, preventing data loss during downstream outages.
Enhanced observability by implementing distributed tracing and summary APIs, reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) for production incidents.
Designed the bridge service synchronizing internal FPS microservices with external Central Fulfilment Centre (CFC) automation.
Implemented a robust state machine to handle out-of-order robotic events, ensuring eventual consistency in a distributed environment.
Built comprehensive audit APIs to monitor synchronization health, facilitating rapid debugging of integration edge cases.
FPS Store Config: Automated store onboarding pipelines with CSV-based validation, replacing error-prone manual configuration tasks.
Label Printing: Architected a dynamic JPOS template engine for Zebra printers, enabling rapid rollout of new label formats without code changes.
Label Printing: Implemented conditional freezer-zone logic to ensure compliance with cold-chain storage requirements.
FPS Adapter: Established 'Golden Path' CI/CD pipelines and SonarQube quality gates, setting the engineering standard for new adapter services.
Founding Engineer for the Logistic Unit Service; designed the core Domain-Driven Design (DDD) model for managing tray and trolley lifecycles.
Implemented complex 'PureGroup' enrichment logic to support optimized inventory tracking across the distributed estate.
Engineered the service for massive horizontal scalability to handle the high-volume event stream of the entire retail network.
Orchestrated the evolution of MoveService into a resilient engine for managing critical resource allocation tasks.
Migrated persistence layers from destructive deletes to immutable updates, establishing a reliable audit trail for resource movements.
Hardened system stability by implementing circuit breakers and exponential backoff strategies for all external integrations.
Delivered the 'Tray Identifier' capability, a strategic feature solving the problem of lost physical inventory in stores.
Optimized the middleware orchestration layer, reducing picking trip generation latency and improving the colleague experience.
Implemented comprehensive audit logging for picked variances, enabling data-driven operational improvements.
Bootstrapped the Decant Planner microservice from scratch, defining the architectural patterns for the new domain.
Established the production-ready scaffolding including Helm charts, Docker strategies, and CI/CD pipelines to accelerate team onboarding.
Defined robust API contracts for decant scheduling, ensuring seamless alignment with Warehouse Management System (WMS) requirements.
Modernized the critical in-store Picking Application to consume event-driven backend microservices, breaking dependencies on legacy monoliths.
Engineered a resilient mock-driven development environment, significantly accelerating feature delivery cycles.
Orchestrated seamless zero-downtime migrations during major backend platform shifts, ensuring uninterrupted operations for thousands of store colleagues.
Operations Data Service: Architected ODS extensions to ingest and normalize high-volume event streams (`luStats`, `pickTrip`) from new Micro-Fulfilment Centres.
Operations Data Service: Configured scalable Kafka stream consumers to unify analytics across disparate fulfilment models.
MFC Manual Picking: Engineered self-healing resilience patterns to handle transient failures in upstream adaptors, preventing cascading operational outages.
MFC DLQ Processor: Built the automated recovery infrastructure for MFC, enabling zero-touch message replay for failed Kafka events.
Decomposed the monolithic Logistic Unit Service into modular, independently deployable units tailored for the Micro-Fulfilment context.
Refactored core domain logic into re-usable libraries, reducing code duplication and enabling granular scaling of API layers.
Ensured rigorous functional parity with legacy systems while optimizing for the low-latency requirements of automated warehouses.
Developed the critical integration layer connecting legacy FPS systems with next-generation Micro-Fulfilment automation stacks.
Implemented comprehensive health-check endpoints and event bridges to guarantee reliable data flow between disparate platforms.
Standardized deployment patterns by enforcing shared CI/CD templates, reducing configuration drift across the MFC ecosystem.
MFC CI/CD: Architected the foundational CI/CD templates for the entire MFC microservices portfolio, enforcing security and quality standards.
MFC CI/CD: Engineered flexible build pipelines with dynamic parameterization, supporting diverse deployment requirements across environments.
Pioneered the implementation of identity and token-based authentication for the Delivery Service, establishing early platform security standards.
Designed selective endpoint enforcement strategies to balance robust security with legacy system compatibility during migration phases.
Developed high-volume shelf-edge sign printing applications, integrating .NET frontends with Mainframe backends for thousands of retail stores.
Optimized batch processing workflows to ensure timely delivery of critical pricing signage.
Built web-based procurement solutions for the energy sector, streamlining complex component acquisition processes.
Implemented responsive interactive UIs using jQuery and JavaScript to significantly improve data entry efficiency.
Developed internal HR applications for the recruiting team, digitizing candidate pipeline management.
Assisted in database schema design and backend stored procedure optimization.
